text:
My #Brexit/#PeoplesVoteMarch take: to quote Homer Simpson: “If you’re gonna get mad at me every time I do something stupid, then I guess I’ll just have to stop doing stupid things.”

This Brexit thing is very stupid/terrible, having another vote to stop it makes sense.

text:
Great House moment:
1. Yesterday he was "The Chairman" who is preparing to deal with the whole Mueller thing.
2. Today he's back in the district ("Homestyle" as Fenno put it) dealing with his constituents' important concerns.

text: Thoughts turn to @DaveAHopkins excellent piece about the media demanding it's right to pick presidents. So Amy = "boring" and only regional press will cover her while Yang = "interesting" because he's going to debate an internet troll about circumcision: http://www.honestgraft.com/2019/03/in-fox-debate-flap-press-defends-its.html …

text: As an aside: something I picked from @Graniteprof's MOOC back in the day (media folks often seem to miss) is just because NH folks come to your event, it doesn't mean they support you. NH voters are a fussy lot and in ways like to size everyone up before they pick.

text: Star Trek Next Generation. Anyway your grading scale is good and I of course am the student who actually shows up and wants to argue about how you giving my paper and A- was "unfair"

text: like STNG gets better and better with each season still there are some howlers in season 7 like Sub Rosa (Crusher has a love affair with a ghost on Planet Ireland? What the hell?) etc etc.
author: huzzahmpls

text: Anyway "jumping the shark" refers to more major changes that really make the show bad/different like focusing Happy Days on Fonzies wackyness rather than him being a great supporting character in an ensemble cast, not just so sub par choices...
author: huzzahmpls

text: Yes, the correct criticism of season 5 IMHO is that it was too much of David Simon's pet issue of problems in journalism which are related to the other themes but also somewhat different, but even so my understanding it's basically the most accurate depiction of a newsroom ever.
author: huzzahmpls

text: We all love dunking on Bret on this website, but this is a good take:

text: I actually think it was good. From what we now about how screwed up the BPD is a rouge cop might be able to get away with some crazy thing like that (for a while at least) and it is great drama in terms of "Welp, Jimmy's finally gone over the edge"
author: huzzahmpls

text: Yes, also if you aren't aware the show was never popular on broadcast (it became a hit due to viral DVDs) and they were never quite sure if they'd get renewed so they tried to make each season ending something of a ending for the series, hence why the season endings are so good.
author: huzzahmpls

text: I agree 5 is the weakest season but it's still really good, and has one of the best endings in TV history so I don't count as "jumping the shark"

text: Well I certainly think there is something to the idea of a certain type of "upper middle class" or "upper upper middle class" person "hoarding" lots of public goods like access to good schools or places to live in nice neighborhoods like The Wedge is a real problem.
author: huzzahmpls

text: but they are the same arguments. As he puts it "He argues that these are "rhetorics of intransigence", which do not further debate." Yup, hence we have them over and over again. End of rant.
author: huzzahmpls

text: "the jeopardy thesis argues that the cost of the proposed change or reform is too high as it endangers some previous, precious accomplishment." BUT WHAT ABOUT PARKING! TRAFFIC! SCHOOLS! AMBULANCES WILL BE STUCK!!!! etc. These claims can come from the "Left" or the "Right"...
author: huzzahmpls

text: or "The futility thesis holds that attempts at social transformation will be unavailing, that they will simply fail to "make a dent."" ie "I can't live in this new building so why build it!" or...
author: huzzahmpls

text: "The perversity thesis" ie "any purposive action to improve some feature of the political, social, or economic order only serves to exacerbate the condition one wishes to remedy." ie "more housing just raises costs!"...
author: huzzahmpls

text: ANYWAY if you want to understand the anti-YIMBY narratives on Twitter I recommend Albert Hirschman's classic The Rhetoric of Reaction: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rhetoric_of_Reaction … All the counter arguments are contained there in such as...
author: huzzahmpls

text: This. Also note the City of Mpls and Hennepin County and others recently did announce a new project of "social housing", it's good! But they don't have much money so it's only 18 units. That's the problem with "social housing" takes.
author: huzzahmpls

text: when I said I was undecided they ended the conversations. Meanwhile Beto's Team took a lot of pride in not hiring "consultants" but maybe that was a problem and led to poor targeting (he did spend a lot of time in very conservative rural areas after all).

text: #hottake: An underappreciated moment of our politics these days is: the GOP is dominated by older white people thus the politics of the Cold War are quite alive, but since the Dem coalition has many more young people and non-white people the interpretation doesn't really carry.
author: huzzahmpls

text: Like a Boss. Will cc @womenalsoknow as I feel like there's a lot to unpack here.

text: In a way it reminds me of the massive push of Clinton Hatred in the 90's but from another ideological direction. Rush joked on his short lived TV show that Chelsea (again at 13 year old girl here) was the "White House Dog" what with media chatter about Soxs the "First Cat"
author: huzzahmpls

text: #hottake: Red Rose Twitter's large scale offensive against Chelsea Clinton is really weird, like she's never held elected office, and much of the screaming at her about her dad's politics is weird considering she was a awkward 12 year old girl with braces back in 93' etc etc
author: huzzahmpls

text: My pleasure! (also not to be a werido, but as a nonprofit person I'm impressed by the whole project, like I doff the hat to your daughters fundraising prowess.)

author: huzzahmpls

text:
Me as as kid: Grandma tell me a story.

Grandma Cleon: It was 1943 and we were at war of course, I had to turn in my bicycle for scrap, to make Sherman tanks. Anyway we wanted a good Sunday dinner as your uncle Richard was on shore leave, things were tight, but I made due.
author: huzzahmpls

text: These youngsters are what's wrong with America! I kid, anyway interesting, I think the formality thing though makes sense as you're relationship is that of teacher to student. Anyway I try my best to always use formal titles when talking/emailing elected officials in my day job.

text: Yeah, it's a striking thing to watch, Tucker doesn't give you much information about...well anything, then he moves into a tirade about why liberals and Democrats are bad and (I guess) to blame.
author: huzzahmpls

text:
Yeah, why this is trending is very strange.

Having said that even as a Midwest middle class white boy I really enjoyed "I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings" it's a very interesting and readable book, a true American classic.
author: huzzahmpls

text:
A chapter for your campaign food book @smotus:

For all the mockery, I feel Beto, Subway is a good campaign food IMHO, like a MRE in the Army it's the energy you need in easily carried bag, and it fights the homesickness of the campaign blues as every Subway is basically the same
author: huzzahmpls

text: Yes, like I'm so old I remember Kerry being written of for dead in the  long hot summer of 2003, not unlike how most people are treating Gillibrand (if they bother to talk about her at all) meanwhile my dreams of #Betomentum seem to have come undone in a whopping 12 hours.
author: huzzahmpls

text: Sheriff is a really important job, I'm glad we have such a fine leader in it here in Hennepin County cc @prof_mirya and @emayfarris
author: huzzahmpls

text: This is a really strange argument: The fact that a super lefty Dem can win in a D+26 district like MN-5 where I live and [squints at notes] Detroit doesn't negate Dems losing two rural districts in MN and Tim Walz blowing the doors off of his more liberal competitors.
author: huzzahmpls

text: Good metaphor for presidential politics right now: We political junkies in general and on this website in particular are Rachel obsessing over stuff like "Does Hickenlooper really have a shot!?!?!" While the electorate is the dog who is uninterested and/or wants you to stop.
author: huzzahmpls

text: That'll work.

text: #Betomentum is running into trouble? Good thing I got on the #Hickenloopermentum train with @smotus on the ground floor!

text: ANYWAY This American Life's great primer on Harold Washington is a good way to spend a Friday afternoon: https://www.thisamericanlife.org/84/harold  also very relevant in terms Trump. Also feel free to pester @williamadler78 with questions about this like "Jane Byrne, yay or nay?"
author: huzzahmpls

text: remarkable man, but he didn't get much done as mayor largely because of "Council Wars" (had he lived this might have been different)). Anyway he clearly walked away from the Chicago Radicalism School of politics long ago, and it's weird people didn't catch this back when.
author: huzzahmpls

text: On a deeper note I think if you read his book it makes sense, his take on the "Council Wars" of Harold Washington's Chicago (a pol he clearly modeled a lot of his career after) was that never ending political trench warfare was quite limiting (and indeed Washington is a...
author: huzzahmpls

text: (I meant "sexiest" but now that I think about it having Ryan Gossling co-host with Tucker would lead to bigger media hype, more viewers, and thus a more "democratic" outcome!)

text: Anyway if the goal is to maximize voting we should have a national April primary done as a TV show hosted by Idris Elba (or whoever the "World's Sexist Man" happens to be) each candidate can get 5 min for a song and dance/speech/stand up routine and we can vote via texting.
author: huzzahmpls

text: That's not the argument, the argument is low turn out primaries are bad because money and what news directors care about dominate the process and we'd be better off if parties controlled it.
author: huzzahmpls

text: Exactly, when it comes to #hickenloopermentum the hope still lives, and the dream shall never die.

text: He starts off his new forward to Dreams of My Father by talking about some mobile housing bill he was working on the day before he wrote the new forward. Likewise one does not run editor of the Harvard Law Review if one wants to overthrow "The System" etc etc

text: Same with Obama! Lots of "Left" people remain bitterly disappointed with him, but that always struck me as being on them: they assumed he was some sort of radical when if you bothered to read his book he was obviously just a conventional liberal Dem in his beliefs all the time...
author: huzzahmpls

text:
Good example of some major problem with "politics jouranlism":
1. I see no evidence of a liberal swooning...
2. A deep rooted commitment to US politics being largely ideological (no it isn't) and DEM CIVIL WAR! narrative (there isn't one)
author: huzzahmpls
